instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message: So I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no image. PP3V3_ SUS is 3.3V. I'm getting voltages on coils. The CPU on this board does get warm but I get no USB activity what so ever. Board is on bench with nothing else plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message:
Do you get even VCORE?
Check all voltages from pages 57/58.
Also check voltage on the L/C blocks between CPU and board edge.

Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL> too?
Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message: I get 1.8v on vcore. Will post back with results of tests of all power rails. Have not tried new bios.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message: I checked every rail from pages 57, 58 & 62. All are present. the only thing "missing" was for <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> which I assume is not present due to the board not posting. I am going to reflash BIOS next...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message: Pretty sure BIOS is corrupt. I have 4 more <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards and the Medusa can copy bios to it but the board in question got stuck at 67% and then I tried it again and it won't even start. At that point do you just take a known good BIOS from another board with the same model number and then just change serial, FSYS and ME region?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message:
You can re-use original ME region if was not already f***d off; just try.
If you cannot read/write SPI chip onboard, remove it and do it with normal programmer.

I bet few clean ME files are already posted on the forum.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image/Chime No USB
threads.message: Tried to clean original ME, did not work. Medusa gives me error. Will try normal programmer.
